data.text:
Wagner Moura Height: Wagner Moura is a Brazilian actor, singer, and lyricist known worldwide for his versatile roles in film and television. Born on June 27, 1976, in Salvador, Brazil, Moura has made significant contributions to the entertainment industry. He is best known for his performances in the “Elite Squad” films and the acclaimed series “Narcos,” where he portrayed the infamous Pablo Escobar. As of 2024, Moura’s net worth is estimated to be around $20 million, reflecting his successful career spanning over two decades.

Early Life and Education

Wagner Moura was born to Aldo Rivas and José Moura in Salvador, Brazil. He grew up in Rodelas, a small town in the state of Bahia, with his sister Lediane. At the age of 13, his family moved back to Salvador. Moura was a bright student and showed early interest in the arts. He graduated from the Federal University of Bahia with a degree in journalism. However, his passion for acting led him to pursue a career in the entertainment industry.

Early Career and Breakthrough

Moura began his acting career in the late 1990s. He made his silver screen debut with a role in the short film “Pop Killer” in 1998. The following year, he appeared in another short film, “Rádió Gogó.” His big breakthrough came in 2003 when he starred in the film “Carandiru,” which depicted the infamous 1992 prison massacre in São Paulo. That same year, he played Zico in “O Caminho das Nuvens” and began acting in the TV series “Sexo Frágil,” remaining part of the cast until 2004 and appearing in 20 episodes.

Rise to Fame

Wagner Moura’s career continued to flourish in the mid-2000s. In 2005, he was cast as Antônio in the film “The Man of the Year” (“O Homem do Ano”). He also starred in “Lower City” (“Cidade Baixa”), a film that received critical acclaim and multiple award nominations. Moura himself was nominated for a Best Actor award at the Rio de Janeiro International Film Festival.

In 2007, Moura starred in the film “Elite Squad” (“Tropa de Elite”), where he played Captain Nascimento, a role that brought him international recognition. The film was a massive success, watched by 180,000 people on its first day and grossing over $14 million at the box office. Moura won several awards for his performance, including the Critics Award for Best Actor and the Audience Award in the same category.

Continued Success and International Recognition

Following the success of “Elite Squad,” Moura continued to take on challenging roles. He reprised his role as Captain Nascimento in the sequel “Elite Squad: The Enemy Within” (“Tropa de Elite 2”) in 2010, which also received widespread acclaim.

From 2007 to 2010, Moura starred in the Brazilian television series “Tropical Paradise” (“Paraíso Tropical”), where he played Olavo, appearing in 167 episodes. In 2012, he landed the starring role of Theo in the drama thriller “Father’s Chair” (“A Busca”). The film won three awards, and Moura received the LABRFF Award for Best Actor.

Hollywood and “Narcos”

Wagner Moura’s talents soon caught the attention of Hollywood. In 2013, he appeared alongside Matt Damon and Jodie Foster in the sci-fi action film “Elysium,” directed by Neill Blomkamp. This role further increased his popularity and net worth.

However, it was his portrayal of Pablo Escobar in the Netflix series “Narcos” that cemented his status as an international star. Moura’s performance as the notorious Colombian drug lord earned him critical acclaim and two Golden Globe nominations. He played the role from 2015 to 2016, delivering a compelling and nuanced performance that showcased his acting range.

Music Career

In addition to acting, Wagner Moura is also active in the music industry. He is the lead vocalist of the Brazilian band Sua Mãe, which translates to “Your Mother.” The band blends rock, samba, and other Brazilian musical styles. Moura’s involvement in music reflects his multifaceted talents and passion for the arts.

Personal Life

Wagner Moura is married to Sandra Delgado, a journalist and photographer. The couple has been together since 2001 and has three sons. Moura is known for his dedication to his family and often keeps his personal life private. He speaks English and Spanish fluently, the latter of which he perfected for his role as Pablo Escobar in “Narcos.”

Wagner Moura Net Worth

As of 2024, Wagner Moura’s net worth is estimated to be around $20 million. His wealth has been accumulated through his extensive work in film, television, and music. Moura’s diverse talents and dedication to his craft have ensured his continued success and financial stability.

Career Highlights

Early Film Roles: Moura began his career with short films like “Pop Killer” and “Rádió Gogó” in the late 1990s.

Breakthrough in “Carandiru”: His role in the 2003 film “Carandiru” brought him national recognition.

“Elite Squad” Films: Moura gained international fame with his role as Captain Nascimento in “Elite Squad” and its sequel, “Elite Squad: The Enemy Within.”

Television Success: He starred in the popular Brazilian TV series “Tropical Paradise” from 2007 to 2010.

Hollywood Debut: Moura appeared in the 2013 sci-fi film “Elysium” alongside Matt Damon and Jodie Foster.

“Narcos”: His portrayal of Pablo Escobar in the Netflix series “Narcos” earned him critical acclaim and two Golden Globe nominations.

Music Career: Moura is the lead vocalist of the Brazilian band Sua Mãe, showcasing his musical talents.

Conclusion [Wagner Moura Height]

Wagner Moura’s journey from a small town in Brazil to international stardom is a testament to his talent, hard work, and dedication. With a successful career in film, television, and music, Moura has become one of Brazil’s most prominent and respected artists. His net worth of $10 million reflects his achievements and contributions to the entertainment industry. As Moura continues to take on new challenges and roles, his legacy as a versatile and talented performer remains firmly established.
